[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Configuration] [Buffered state tuning attack] Can an attacker set buffered_state_target_items to 1 to force synchronous writes, degrading performance to unusable levels? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Configuration] [Indexer resource consumption] Does enabling indexer without limits allow unbounded index growth that exhausts disk space? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [State consistency] [State summary mismatch] If persisted_summary doesn't match actual persisted state, can this cause merkle proof verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [State consistency] [Hot state divergence] Can hot_state and persisted_state diverge over time if updates aren't properly synchronized, causing state forks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Merkle tree] [Node cache coherency] With cache disabled (max_node_cache: 0), can stale nodes be read from disk causing merkle tree inconsistencies? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Merkle tree] [Root hash manipulation] Can direct access to state_merkle_db allow modification of intermediate nodes that changes the root hash without updating leaf values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Transaction processing] [Gas overflow] If transaction_info.gas_used() returns u64::MAX, can this cause overflow in gas accounting? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Transaction processing] [Status inconsistency] Can TransactionStatus::Keep be set for transactions that should fail, bypassing validation checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Transaction processing] [Auxiliary data size] Is transaction_auxiliary_data size-limited, or can unbounded auxiliary data cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Transaction processing] [Write set size] Are write_set sizes validated, or can extremely large write sets cause excessive memory allocation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/db/aptosdb_testonly.rs] [Initialization] [Concurrent initialization] Can multiple threads call different new_for_test*() functions simultaneously on the same path, causing file system races? (High)
